page.title: 04INTERESTING BUILDINGS
page.content: Howick Hall was built by Sir Henry Grey from designs by Newton of Newcastle.The house which is a fine building in the classical style was enlarged and altered by the second Earl Grey in 1812.It stands upon the site of a small medieval tower which was pulled down in 1780. Howick Church stands in the grounds of Howick Hall. There has been a chapel at Howick since the year 1158, but the present church,dedicated to St.Michael, was rebuilt and enlarged by the third Earl Grey in 1849. Longhoughton Church,dedicated to St.Peter is of a much earlier date;the east wall of the nave dating back to the Norman Conquest.The tower and the aisle were built at the end of the eleventh century.the chancel is modern,built from the ancient stones. All these buildings are worth a visit.
